posts.post_content:
@Brimand  
  
Just have a Planar Portal and Myr Matrix handy, the portal to get the Matrix if necessary. And lots of card drawing. My stepdad loves to ramp up his mana to ramp up his Myrs to ramp up his Beast of Burdens, and to make Coat of Arms that much more vicious. Even before mana burn was eliminated, he found ways to funnel his mana.

posts.post_content: watch out for the fallout, this card can sometimes bite you right back, in an artifact deck later in the game this card can give you upwards of 30 mana, and if you can't use all of them then you take mana burn, sometimes even enough to kill you.

Posted By: land_comment (3/9/2011 7:27:42 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
always enjoyed using this card, pretty much a game winner once it is out, use it with other artifacts that shut down when tapped and [Clock of Omens](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Clock of Omens) to prevent your opponent from getting any abilities, especially now that mana burn no longer exists.  
  
most obvious usage is of course [lattice](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=lattice)  
  
best usage I got out of it back in myr-ridin was [clockwork dragon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=clockwork dragon), [gemstone array](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=gemstone array), and [Thopter Squadron](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Thopter Squadron)/[pentavus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=pentavus)
posts.html:
always enjoyed using this card, pretty much a game winner once it is out, use it with other artifacts that shut down when tapped and Clock of Omens to prevent your opponent from getting any abilities, especially now that mana burn no longer exists.

most obvious usage is of course lattice

best usage I got out of it back in myr-ridin was clockwork dragon, gemstone array, and Thopter Squadron/pentavus
